title.narrative: GOVERNANCE SUPPORT TO Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SECTOR

description.narrative: The legal, institutional and technical capacities of the government structures at the central, provincial and municipal levels are enhanced and they contribute to the promotion of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) activities and the sustainable management of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) facilities., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2016 - Outcome 4 / Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH): By 2016, populations in provinces with low access to potable water and basic sanitation have an improved access to these services and adopt appropriate hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The legal, institutional and technical capacities of the government structures at the central, provincial and municipal levels areenhanced and they contribute to the promotion of WASH activities and the sustainable management of WASH facilities.

description.narrative: In 2018, UNICEF Burundi continued its comprehensive approach to enhance national capacity and accountability in the WASH sector through the promotion of system sustainability and risk-informed planning for community resilience. UNICEF Burundi was designated the lead agency for the WASH sector development partners group. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
